Local Binary Patterns implementation¶

lbpcalc.isUniform(n, c)¶

A function checking whether a binary sequence is uniform or not

A binary sequence is called uniform iff it cantains up to two binary transitions. For example: the sequnces 001100 and 111000 are uniform and 11001100 is not.

Parameters

  • n (int) – Length of the bit sequence

  • c (int) – Integer containing the bit sequnece as its suffix

Returns

True if the sequence is uniform

Return type

bool

class lbpcalc.LBPCalc(sizes)¶

A general implementation of the LBP operator. Allows the use of different operator sizes and strides

__init__(sizes)¶
Parameters

sizes (tuple((int, int))) – LBP sizes to be precalculated for faster execution

calcMap(p)¶

Calculates a dictionary that maps every uniform sequence to itself and every non-uniform one to 5 (the smallest number that is not uniform used as an extra label)

Parameters

p (int) – The length of the binary squences

Returns

int: The mapping that was calculated

Return type

dict of int

calcRevMap(p)¶

Calculates a dictionary that maps uniform sequences (and the extra label 5) to a contiguous sequence of integers

Parameters

p (int) – The length of the binary squences

Returns

int: The mapping that was calculated

Return type

dict of int

histogram(rawImage, size, windowSize=(-1, -1), xOffset=0, yOffset=0, extract=<function LBPCalc.<lambda>>, step=1)¶

Computes the LBPs of an image and generates a histogram of the calculated data

Parameters

  • rawImage (numpy.ndarray) – The image to be processed

  • size ((int, int)) – The size of the LBP operator

  • windowSize ((int, int)) – The size of the part of the image that will be used in computation given as (height, width)

  • xOffset (int, optional) – Starting pixel x offset for the LBP operator

  • yOffset (int, optional) – Starting pixel y offset for the LBP operator

  • extract (TODO, optional) – Method of extracting color values from a pixel

  • step (int, optional) – LBP operator step size along a single axis

Returns

The calcualted histogram

Return type

list(int)

lbp(rawImage, size, windowSize=(-1, -1), xOffset=0, yOffset=0, extract=<function LBPCalc.<lambda>>, step=1)¶

The LBP operator

TODO: Longer decsription

Parameters

  • rawImage (numpy.ndarray) – The image to be processed

  • size ((int, int)) – The size of the operator

  • windowSize ((int, int)) – The size of the part of the image that will be used in computation given as (height, width)

  • xOffset (int, optional) – Starting pixel x offset

  • yOffset (int, optional) – Starting pixel y offset

  • extract (TODO, optional) – Method of extracting color values from a pixel

  • step (int, optional) – Step size along a single axis

Returns

The processed 16-bit image

Return type

numpy.ndarray

lbpOperator(img, x, y, w, h, deltas, extract=<function LBPCalc.<lambda>>, step=1)¶

Calculates the LBP label for a pixel at given coordinated using deltas to sample neighbouring pixels. This method is described in greater detail in the thesis

Parameters

  • img (numpy.ndarray) – The image to be provessed

  • x (int) – X coordinate of the center pixel

  • y (int) – Y coordinate of the center pixel

  • w (int) – Width of the image

  • h (int) – Height of the image

  • deltas (list((int, int))) – Pixel offsets for retiving samples

  • extract (TODO, optional) – Method of extracting color values from a pixel

  • step (int, optional) – Step size along a single axis

precalcLbpDeltas()¶

Calculates the relative positions of points used by the LBP operator in advance to optimaze the calculations

precalcMaps()¶

Prepares the precalulated maps
